basics.name: Wilson Espina!
basics.label: Front End Software Engineer at ITV
basics.summary:
From an early age I was always interested in understanding how things work, taking them apart and building them up again. This fascination steered me towards studying civil engineering and follow an early career within infrastructure projects.  However, in my roles I was always on the periphery of construction and never got hands on with builds. Having always been interested in the tech world outside of work, I tried a weekend course in front-end web development and found my calling. 

I ended up taking the WDI course at GA where I found that web development gave me the perfect blend of building something tangible and being challenged to come up with creative solutions to coding problems. I’m excited by the prospects of being able to apply the skills I’ve learnt at GA in the tech world where I can grow as a developer, build more websites and continue to learn.

work.name: General Assembly
work.position: Lead Instructor for JavaScript Development Part Time Course

work.name: General Assembly
work.position: Teaching Assistant for Front End Web Development Part Time Course

work.name: General Assembly
work.summary:
In 2017, I completed an intensive bootcamp at General Assembly London where I learnt a range of web development and agile project techniques. Each morning started with daily standups and days regularly involved pair programming, understanding and implementing technical concepts and UX fundamentals. The course also covered a variety of front and back end frameworks and development tools which were put to use in my major portfolio projects:

♣ Project 4: 
https://running-trace.herokuapp.com/
My final project at General Assembly was to create a full MERN stack application with an open scope to create a RESTful site within a week. The website ended up being a social exercising platform which encourages people to compete and upload the best running traces they’ve saved on the social exercise app, Strava. 

♣ Project 3:
https://gigly-wilson.herokuapp.com/
where our product was a social music event app designed for people to create groups attending upcoming gigs. Our application used a MEAN stack and combined three external API’s, pulling event information from Ticketmaster, playing relevant songs from Spotify and displaying the location for each event using Google Maps. 

♣ Project 2:
https://katsuper-store.herokuapp.com/
For my second major project at GA, I created my first fully RESTful application with backend authentication using Express.js Sessions. This project was my first opportunity to get to grips with an application that demonstrated the create, read update, delete (CRUD) functionality found in most websites.

♣ Project 1:
https://can-you-diglett.herokuapp.com/
My first project at GA was to build an interactive game using JavaScript and jQuery for DOM manipulation. This was my first opportunity to apply my early JS knowledge to a working app and to also apply CSS styling to my own product. The overall look and feel of the app was that of a retro 8-bit arcade game with a simple colour scheme and mocked-up game controllers in the user interface.

work.name: High Speed Two (HS2) Ltd
work.summary:
HS2 Ltd is responsible for developing and promoting the UK’s new high speed rail network being delivered in 2026.

♣	Supported the Utilities Delivery team in the application of HS2 processes and tailoring bespoke methodologies to manage the utilities works programme. 
♣	Wrote and implemented the utilities Project Execution Plan which outlined all major systems of working practices with both internal and external stakeholders.
♣	Undertook role as a Health & Safety champion actively supporting the business to promote and implement it’s Safe at Heart practices.

work.name: High Speed Two (HS2) Ltd
work.summary:
♣	Coordinated the utility team’s change control process by ensuring all utility affected changes falling outside of originally scopes parameters escalated along the correct channels of corporate governance.
♣	Facilitated implementation of HS2 IT systems, including Bentley Enterprise Bridge (eB) and ProjectWise, to external stakeholders and organised subsequent training sessions. 
♣	Attended regular meetings to monitor the progress of scheme specific issues, risks and mitigations and reporting back to senior management on progress.

work.name: FileWorks
work.summary:
Fileworks is a Filing Consultancy Practice that implements efficient solutions for
storing, accessing and sharing hard copy and electronic information.

♣Collected asset information and performed quantitative analysis to provide recommendations on best working practices as seen in other offices around the UK.

♣Liaised closely with clients ranging from boardroom level to administration staff to provide effective office storage solutions and working practices through benchmarking within similar industries.

♣Responsible for managing the strategic operation and day-to-day management of a £100k+ contract with Network Rail to relocate 3,000 staff and their filing from multiple sites across the UK to one location in The Quadrant:Milton Keynes.

volunteer.summary:
The Ugandan Rural Development and Training Programme (URDT) is an educational facility in Uganda specialising in teaching engineering expertise to school children.

♣	Project managed the development of rural technology for the URDT Institute and took steps towards determining the feasibility of a proposed sustainable energy micro hydroelectric plant. 
♣	Compiled a feasibility report performing a cost vs. benefit analysis on the electric plant, taking a holistic approach using data collected from site surveys.
♣	Managed a small team of four students in the design and build of a large concrete roof section with only basic tools and workshop facilities available.

education.area: Web Page, Digital/Multimedia and Information Resources Design

references.name: James T.
references.reference: The first thing I noticed about Wilson is his incredible work ethic. His harding working attitude is a true inspiration.  During the course we have to complete mini projects almost everyday. I always see him working very late in the evenings after a long day in class. I've never seen him miss a deadline!

references.name: David Cooper
references.reference: I worked with Wilson to create an Angular app, pair programming and as part of a four-person team. He was technically very strong as well as being an excellent problem-solver and team player ... and unfailingly good-humoured in all circumstances.

references.name: Hannah Cross
references.reference: Wilson Espina was one of my first friends on the GA course. He is very personable and has fantastic banter! Working with him on assignments was a lot of fun. He is organised and has a great sense of design and user experience. A fantastic person to pair-program and work through problems with.
